00019 class Command;
00020 class wxString;

00022 // CommandBuilder has the task of validating and interpreting a command string.
00023 // If the string represents a valid command, it builds the command object.
00024 
00025 class CommandBuilder
00026 {
00027    private:
00028       bool mValid;
00029       Command *mCommand;
00030       wxString mError;
00031 
00032       void Failure(const wxString &msg = wxEmptyString);
00033       void Success(Command *cmd);
00034       void BuildCommand(const wxString &cmdName, wxString cmdParams);
00035       void BuildCommand(wxString cmdString);
00036    public:
00037       CommandBuilder(const wxString &cmdString);
00038       CommandBuilder(const wxString &cmdName, 
00039                      const wxString &cmdParams);
00040       ~CommandBuilder();
00041       bool WasValid();
00042       Command *GetCommand();
00043       void Cleanup();
00044       const wxString &GetErrorMessage();
00045 };
00046 #endif /* End of include guard: __COMMANDBUILDER__ */
